Module ru.nsu.lebedev.snake
Package ru.nsu.lebedev.snake.game

Class GameSnake

java.lang.Object
ru.nsu.lebedev.snake.game.GameSnake
public class GameSnake extends Object
Represents the snake in the game.

  • Constructor Details

    • GameSnake

      public GameSnake(int initialSize, GamePoint startPoint, GameVector initialDirection, ModelGame gameModel)
      Constructs a snake with a specified size and starting position.
      Parameters:
      initialSize - Initial size of the snake.
      startPoint - Starting position of the snake.
      initialDirection - Initial movement direction.
      gameModel - Reference to the game model.

  • Method Details

    • setDirection

      public boolean setDirection(GameVector newDirection)
      Sets the movement direction if it's not collinear with the current one.
      Parameters:
      newDirection - The new direction.
      Returns:
      True if the direction was changed, false otherwise.

    • getDirection

      public GameVector getDirection()
      Gets the snake's direction.
      Returns:
      The direction.

    • getHead

      public GamePoint getHead()
      Gets the snake's head.
      Returns:
      The head position.

    • getBody

      public LinkedList<GamePoint> getBody()
      Gets the snake's body (excluding the head).
      Returns:
      The body as a linked list of points.

    • getWholeBody

      public LinkedList<GamePoint> getWholeBody()
      Gets the full body of the snake, including the head.
      Returns:
      A list of all snake's positions.

    • getTail

      public GamePoint getTail()
      Gets the snake's tail position.
      Returns:
      The last body segment, or the head if the body is empty.

    • getSize

      public int getSize()
      Gets the total size of the snake.
      Returns:
      The number of segments (body + head).

    • move

      public void move()
      Moves the snake in its current direction, updating its position.

    • grow

      public void grow()
      Increases the snake's length by one segment.

    • isAlive

      public boolean isAlive()
      Checks whether the snake is still alive.
      Returns:
      True if the snake is alive, false otherwise.

    • isDead

      public boolean isDead()
      Checks whether the snake is dead.
      Returns:
      True if the snake has died, false otherwise.
